title: Walter Tracy
content:
Hi everyone.  
Does anyone know if Walter Tracy's Telegraph Modern (1969) is available in digital form somewhere ? I'm quite sure I saw it used on a flyer designed by Dutch studio Coup in Amsterdam a few weeks ago, but I could be wrong, of course. Thank you very much.
author: Celeste

comments.content:
Under a different name, is this the same thing? [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/modern/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020063305/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/modern/)

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Ever since I chose to block pop-ups, my toaster's stopped working.

No, this one is a hoax — it wasn't even designed by Tracy, I think.  
Telegraph Modern is a text face with Roman, Italic and Bold.  
Thanks, anyway

If it's the font I'm thinking of, I don't know of any  
digital versions, but I can tell you that Folha and  
Floris by De Groot have some similarity to it.

hhp
Bob, you've nailed it ! Thank you very much.
